Disguised as police, they broke through a fence on Monday evening and broke into the cargo of a Swiss-bound plane to take the diamonds worth an estimated €50 million ($54.5 million) at Brussels Airport, authorities reported Tuesday.

The well-orchestrated heist occurred around 8:30 PM local time when eight armed individuals, wearing police uniforms and driving two fake police vehicles, breached the airport's perimeter security. The thieves targeted a Brinks security transport that was loading valuable cargo onto a Swiss International Air Lines flight.

According to airport spokesperson Ellen De Visscher, the perpetrators threatened ground staff at gunpoint before accessing the cargo hold. No shots were fired, and no injuries were reported during the incident.
